channel.title: Scott Weiland on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in Scott Weiland on My New Hugo Site

item.title: I’ll Do Something Innovative When I Die
item.description: [whitebox] [big]Today in Tedium: Death is a weird thing. Everyone does it eventually (unless they’re immortal), and we don’t always have control over when it happens. (If you’re reading this right now, you’ve confirmed that I did not die in the production of this issue.) But the problem is that death is a very sensitive thing, it’s loaded with emotions, it’s expensive, and it’s hard to get right. Perhaps that’s why “death” and “innovation” don’t tend to be so closely associated with one another.

item.title: Trippin' On A Hole In A Paper Heart
item.description: [whitebox] [big]Today in Tedium: As we were putting the finishing touches on last Thursday’s Tedium, a terrible bit of news hit the internet—the death of Scott Weiland, one of the most influential rock vocalists of the last quarter-century. Weiland’s death, for many, was not a surprise, and that fact was touched upon by his former band, Stone Temple Pilots. In 2013, Weiland was kicked out of the band he helped make famous, leading to a lengthy legal battle between the two sides.
